intro: Scolopia septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern scolopia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the northeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, upright stems that bear small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Scolopia septentrionalis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks.
